message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.DS, cs.NE 

This paper deals with the problem of learning classifiers in the presence of label noise, which is a common issue in machine learning. The paper proposes a method to make risk minimization tolerant to label noise, which is a topic that falls under the category of machine learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper discusses the performance of different loss functions, which is relevant to the sub-categories of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). The paper also mentions the use of classifiers in computer vision applications, which is relevant to the sub-category of cs.CV (Computer Vision). Finally, the paper uses empirical studies to compare the proposed method with the SVM algorithm, which is a topic that falls under the sub-category of cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms).
